artist: Painter: William Hogarth; Engraver: Joseph Sympson Jr.; Printer: Joseph Sympson Sr.
description: courtroom with justice at desk; pregnant woman with hand raised swearing that child seated in chair next to justice is child of elderly man with hans raised; woman next to man is his unhappy wife
inscription:
Inscription

on sheet below image in black: [W. Hogarth pinx.  J. Sympson, Jun\'r sculp./Here Justice triumphs in his Elbow Cahir,/ and makes his Market of the trading Fair;/ His Office Shelves with Parish Laws are grac\'d/ But Spelling Books and Guides between \'em plac\'d./ Here pregnant Madam screens the real sire,/ and finally swears her Bastard Child for Hire/ Upon a righ old Letcher who denies/ The Fact , and vows the naughty Hussie lies;/ His Wife enraged, exclaims against her Spouse,/ And swears She\'d be reveng\'d upon his Brows;/ The Jade, The Justice and the Church Ward\'ns agree,/ and force him to provide Security/  Sold by J. Sympson, Engraver and Printseller at the Dove in Russell Court Drury Lane; in pencil below image: [1-541]; on verso UR Corner in pencil: [44/44]
title: Untitled
